designerHtml5DropLabel: HTML5 Drop File is not supported!
designerStartupModuleLinkTitle: Select the module your application will start with
designerInputSearchRegexTitle: Type a filter to narrow down listed modules. Regex syntax supported
designerSettingsModalCredencialsLabel1: Credentials for accessing Restcomm API. You should provide these if
dialStepDropAreaLabel: Drag one or more Number/Client/Conference/SipURI nouns to add destinations
dialStepNumberSendDigitsTooltip: Send these DTMF tones after dialing the number
dialStepNumberBeforeConnectTooltip: Play or say information to the called party, or provide a chance to decline the phone call using 'Collect' and 'Hangup'
dialStepConferenceWaitTooltip: A module or URL to play while waiting to be added to the conference. If URL is speficied, both RCML and .wav resources can be targeted. Use it with Start-on-enter set to NO
dialStepConferenceMutedTooltip: Specify whether a participant can speak in the conference
dialStepConferenceBeepTooltip: A notification beep is played to the conference when a participant joins or leaves the conference
dialStepConferenceMaxTooltip: The maximum number of participants allowed in the conference
dialStepContinueTooltip: Choose the module to continue to after the end of the call. 'core_DialCallStatus', 'core_DialCallSid', 'core_DialCallDuration' and 'core_RecordingUrl' (if Recording is enabled) variables will be available.
dialStepContinueTimeoutTooltip: The limit in seconds that Dial waits for the called party to answer the call
dialStepContinueTimeLimitTooltip: The maximum duration of the Dial in seconds
dialStepContinueCalledIdTooltip: The caller ID that will appear to the called party when RestComm calls
dialStepRecordingConferenctWarning: Recording for Conference is not supported yet
downloadNotAvailableLabel: Sorry, your application package is not available
downloadIsAvailableLabel1: Your application binary package is available. Click
downloadContinueLabel2: editing this app in Visual Designer
exceptionConfigModalAddHandlerLabel: Add handler modules for various exceptions. Type the exception name to the left and the module that will handle the error to the right.
exceptionConfigModalCatchAllLabel: A catch all handler to be used if no specific mapping applies
externalServiceStepServiceUrlTooltip: Specify the extrernal service URL. Avoid passing query parameters directly and use 'Add URL parameter' button below.
externalServiceStepIgnoredParamsWarning: Service parameters are not used in POST/PUT requests by default. Check 'Automatically populate from service parameters' to alter this behaviour
externalServiceStepUsernameTooltip: Username for BASIC HTTP authentication. Leave it blank if no authentication is used.
externalServiceStepPasswordTooltip: Password for BASIC HTTP authentication. Leave it blank if no authentication is used.
externalServiceStepFormErrorLabel: Specify a valid URL that returns JSON
externalServiceStepAddParamButtonPopover: Add a name-value service parameter. Depending on the method and content-type parameters are placed in the query or the body of the request
externalServiceStepAssignResponseText1: Assign JSON response fields to RVD variables to access the data returned from RVD components. Create an assignment for each separate piece of information you need.
externalServiceStepAssignResponseText3: Fill in the 'Assign to' field with the name of the RVD variable you want to create.
externalServiceStepAssignResponseText4: Click 'Add operation' to add one or more access operations until you drill down to the JSON member variable you need. For objects use the 'propertyNamed' action to access a specific property. For arrays use the 'itemAtPosition' action to access the N'th array element.
externalServiceStepAssignResponseText5: The last operation should be 'value'. Don't forget to press 'Done' when done.
externalServiceStepAssignResponseText6: Undo your mistakes with the circular arrow button.
externalServiceStepAssignResponseText7: All variables variables created this way will be available for use in this module (or the next if a 'fixed' routing decision is made).
externalServiceStepAssignResponseText9: If dynamic or mapped routing is enabled you can limit the scope of an RVD variable to a single module by choosing it from the 'Module scope' dropdown. Leave it blank to execute the assignment for all modules.
externalServiceStepMakeRoutingText1: Check 'Continue to' checkbox below to change call flow after the external service has responded:
externalServiceStepMakeRoutingText2: Select 'fixed' to use a hardcoded module setting.
externalServiceStepMakeRoutingText3: Select 'dynamic' to route to a module specified in the service response. In your service implementation use the label of the module (the caption on module's the tab) to indicate your choice. Notice 'Module scope' option is enabled for each assignment. You can then select a module from the dropdown list to execute the assignment for this module only. Leave it blank to execute it for all module routes.
externalServiceStepMakeRoutingText4: Select 'mapped' to create mappings from values returned in your response to destination modules. The 'Module Scope' behaviour described in 'dynamic' applies here too.
externalServiceStepMakeRoutingText5: Leave 'Continue to' unchecked if you don't want to change the call flow at this point.
externalServiceStepRemoteErrorTitle: Route to this module if an HTTP error code is returned
faxStepFaxLabelPopover: Type the fax content as text. Prepend variables with a dollar sign like '$variablename'
faxStepContinueTooltip: Choose the module to continue to after the fax has been enqueued. 'FaxStatus' and 'FaxSid' variables will be available. Leave it blank to continue to the next step.
faxStepStatusTooltip: Type a URL to get notified about the fax sending final status. A POST request will be made with parameters 'FaxStatus' and 'FaxSid'
enailStepEmailLabelPopover: Type the email content as text.
sayEmailSubjectValidationError: Please insert a subject for the email
sayEmailValidationError: Please insert a valid email address
emailStepBccLabelPopover: Add email addresses separated with a coma (,)
emailStepCcLabelPopover: Add email addresses separated with a coma (,)
emailStepContinueTooltip: Choose the module to continue to after the email has been enqueued. Leave it blank to continue to the next step.
emailStepStatusTooltip: Type a URL to get notified about the fax sending final status. A POST request will be made with parameters 'FaxStatus' and 'FaxSid'
formSaveReguiredNotification: Please complete all required fields (*) before saving.
formDownloadNewTitle: save package first to enable downloading
formPackageAppLabel1: Package your application to submit it to the
formProvideConfigurationLabel: Provide configuration options for plugging this application into the end user's environment.
formOfficialNameLabel: Official application name for the app store
formDescribeAppLabel: Describe your application. A small text of 40-60 words is optimal.
formHowToHelp: Type a small text describing general configuration guidelines. HTML markup is also supported.
formConfigurationProvisioningUrlHelp1: URL for application provisioning. Incoming number and parameters hooks are supported. Read more
formConfigurationWebUIHelp: URL for lauching application's Web UI if available
formAppParametersHelp: Customize your app by adding parameters. Add a parameter for any piece of information you need to be adjusted by the end user. Users of this application will have the opportunity to fill in these options in order to customize their installation.
formNameTooltip: An identifier for this option. It will be used to map this option to an RVD variable
formLabelTooltip: A label for the generated option field. Try to choose an appropriate label.
formDefaultValuePlaceholder: Welcome to the IVR clinic. Nice to see you.
formDefaultValueTooltip: Type an optional default value for the field. It will be pre-filled with it.
formAppParamsRequiredTooltip: Is this field required ?  Your application should handle absence of this field properly.
formDescriptionPlaceholder: This is the first message you callers hear. Welcome them and inform them what comes next.
formDescriptionTooltip: Describe what this field is used for and how it should be completed
formConfigurationInitOptionTooltip: Should this field be transmitted to the Web UI when this is launched ?
formConfigurationMultitenancyMessage1: If your application relies on multitenant external services you will need to specify
formConfigurationMultitenancyMessage2: Used to identify each individual instance of this application to the backend. It also works as an authentication token.
gatherStepDescriptionLabel3: commands  below to prompt the user to type some digits
gatherStepCreateMenuLabel: Create a menu or collect digits
gatherStepValidationPatternTooltip: Define acceptable input by using a regex pattern. Leave blank for no validation.
gatherStepSayInvalidPlaceholder: You typed a wrong option. Please try again
gatherStepNumberOfDigitsConflictWarning: value may conflict with Number of digits
logStepTextLabelPopover: Log a message to the application log. Prepend variables names with a dollar sign e.g. '$variablename'
pauseStepLengthTooltip: How many seconds to wait silently before continuing on
playStepUrlFileLabel: Type the URL resource of the .wav file
playStepUrlFileBundleUrlTitle: Type a custom URL to a remote audio resource or select one from the RVD bundle
playStepUrlFileError2: Please select a file from the list
playStepLoopTooltip: How many times the file audio resource will be played. Default is '1'. '0' will loop until the call is hang up.
projectManagerChooseProjectLabel2: project from the list below or create a new one
projectManagerDropProjectsLabel: Drop RVD projects (.zip) here to import
projectManagerHtml5DropLabel: HTML5 Drop File is not supported!
projectManagerChooseDifferentLabel2: Choose a different kind of project
recordStepContinueToTooltip: Choose the module to continue to after recording. 'core_RecordingUrl', 'core_RecordingDuration' and 'core_Digits' variables will be available.
recordStepTimeoutTooltip: Set the maximum length for the recording in seconds
recordStepFinishTooltip: End the recording immediately after a key has been pressed. 'Any key' will stop upon pressing any key. 'DISABLED won't stop at all. 'Type some keys...' allows you to selectively specify which keys will stop recording.
recordStepMaxTooltip: Set the maximum length for the recording in seconds
recordStepTranscribeTooltip: If selected a text representation of the audio of the recording will be created
recordStepTranscribeCallbackTooltip: Specify a URL to make an asynchronous POST request when the transcription is complete. 'TranscriptionStatus', 'TranscriptionText', 'TranscriptionUrl' and 'RecordingUrl' parameters will be passed.
sayStepTextLabelPopover: Type the text that will be read to the user. Prepend variables names with a dollar sign e.g. '$variablename'
sayStepLoopTooltip: How many times the text will be repeated. Default is '1'. '0' will loop until the call is hang up.
smsStepSmsTextLabelPopover: Type the SMS message to send. Use RVD variables like '$variablename'
smsStepContinueToTooltip: Choose the module to continue to after processing sms step. If nothing is selected call flow will continue to the next step.
smsStepStatusCalbackTooltip: Type a URL to get notified about the sms sending final status. A POST request will be made with parameters 'SmsStatus' and 'SmsSid'
upgradeNeedsUpgradeLabel2: was created using a different version of RVD.
ussdCollectStepUssdMessageTooltip: Type the message text. Add multiple messages to display separate lines.
valueExtractorPropertyInputPlaceholder: type the object property to access
webTriggerModalDescriptorLabel: Web trigger allows starting your application using a simple HTTP call
webTriggerModalWebTriggerUrlHelp5: URL parameters can be omitted if
webTriggerModalWebTriggerUrlHelp7: values have been defined. Also, additional parameters can be appended to the url. They will be available as
webTriggerModalWebTriggerUrlHelp9: RVD variables when the application starts
webTriggerModalAccessTokenHelp1: Protect your Web Trigger URL with an access token. If set, make sure you provide the same
webTriggerModalAccessTokenHelp3: parameter when making the HTTP call. Leave it blank to allow free access.
webTriggerMissingAccessTokenWarn: Access token is empty! Your trigger may only be accessed using HTTP basic authentication.
webTriggerModalFallbackParamTitle2: Destination to get dialed when application starts
webTriggerModalFallbackParamHelp5: values in case they are not supplied in the HTTP call
webTriggerModalFallbackParamHelp10: values use the Restcomm RCML dial syntax. For example:
esTimeoutTooltip: Divert application flow to the specified module in case the service takes too long to respond (optional)
